instruction: In TypeScript, how can I tell the type system "I know that in theory this value may have these multiple types, but in practice I know it will only have this one"
output:
?
How can I tell the type system "I know that in theory this value may have these multiple types, but in practice I know it will only have this one"?
The type system is telling you that in theory, a variable of type number could have any number of values, and that in theory a variable of type boolean could have any number of values. But in practice, in this specific scenario, the variable only has one of two possible values.
In TypeScript, we can use a union type to represent multiple possible types. A union type is a type that represents any of the types in the union. For example, the type number | boolean represents a value that could be either a number or a boolean.
However, sometimes we know that in a specific scenario, a variable will only have one of the possible values in the union. In this case, we can use the as keyword to cast the variable to the specific type that we know it will have.
For example, consider the following code:
let x: number | boolean;
x = 5; // x is now of type number
console.log(x.toFixed()); // this will work
x = true; // x is now of type boolean
console.log(x.toFixed()); // this will throw an error
In this code, we declare a variable x that can be either a number or a boolean. We then assign a number to x, which makes x have the type number. We then call the toFixed method on x, which works because x is now of type number.
However, when we assign a boolean to x, x now has the type boolean. When we try to call the toFixed method on x again, we get an error because x is now of type boolean and the toFixed method is only defined for numbers.
To fix this, we can use the as keyword to cast x to the type number, which will allow us to call the toFixed method again:
let x: number | boolean;
x = 5; // x is now of type number
console.log(x.toFixed()); // this will work
x = true; // x is now of type boolean
x as number; // cast x to the type number
console.log(x.toFixed()); // this will work again

output:
If so, you might have what it takes to be an astronaut. The NASA Johnson Space Center in Houston is looking for people to apply for the next class of astronauts.
The application process is open until Feb. 18, 2016. You can apply online. NASA says you need to be a U.S. citizen with a bachelor’s degree from an accredited institution and at least three years of experience or 1,000 hours of pilot-in-command time in jet aircraft. You also must be less than 47 years old.
The job pays $66,026 a year.
But don’t think you’re in the clear just because you can fly a plane. The astronaut application process is a long one. First, you’ll have to submit a resume, transcripts and three letters of recommendation. Then you’ll have to take a medical exam, physical fitness test and an interview.
Only about 8 percent of the people who apply make it to the final round of interviews. From there, about 10 people are selected.
If you make it to the final round of interviews, you’ll have to pass a battery of tests to show you’re physically and mentally fit for the job. You’ll have to pass a flight physical and a NASA flight surgeon will need to determine you are able to function in the space environment. You’ll also have to pass a psychological and cognitive assessment, a vision test and an EKG.
If you make it through all of that, you’ll have to pass a NASA panel interview. You’ll be asked questions about your leadership and teamwork skills, your education and training, your motivation and your ability to work with others.
After all that, NASA will pick 10 to 15 new astronauts. They’ll go through another year of training. Then they’ll be assigned to missions.
The application deadline is Feb. 18, 2016. Click here to apply.

instruction: What are the main methods used by car manufacturers to reduce emissions in their ICE cars besides trying to lower the amount of fuel the engine uses?
output:
Are there any new methods being developed that might help us get to the next generation of clean cars?
The major method used to reduce emissions in cars is to lower the amount of fuel the engine uses. This is accomplished by improving the efficiency of the engine. As a result, more power is produced with less fuel. This is achieved through improved engine design, which includes variable valve timing, better combustion, and higher compression ratios. Additionally, modern cars are equipped with emission control systems that help to reduce the amount of pollutants released into the atmosphere.
The next generation of clean cars will likely use a combination of these methods, as well as other innovative technologies. For example, electric cars use no fuel at all, and therefore do not produce any emissions. They are powered by electricity, which is generated by a variety of sources, including renewable energy. Other methods that are being developed include hybrid cars, which use both an electric motor and a gasoline engine, and fuel cells, which use hydrogen as a fuel source.
In conclusion, the main methods used by car manufacturers to reduce emissions in their cars are to lower the amount of fuel the engine uses and to use emission control systems. instruction: Why don't people like the many-worlds interpretation of quantum mechanics?
output:
[closed]
In my opinion, the many-worlds interpretation of quantum mechanics is a very elegant solution to the measurement problem, and it doesn't have any problems with infinities like the Wheeler-deWitt equation. It also has a lot of predictions that are confirmed by experiments. For example, it predicts that if we take a single photon and send it through a beam splitter, the probability of finding the photon in either output is 50%. If we send two photons through the beam splitter, the probability of finding both photons in the same output is 25%, and the probability of finding one photon in one output and the other photon in the other output is 50%. This is exactly what is observed in experiments. Why do people still think that the many-worlds interpretation is not a valid interpretation of quantum mechanics?
closed as primarily opinion-based by John Rennie, Jon Custer, ZeroTheHero, GiorgioP, user191954 Sep 26 '18 at 13:59
$\begingroup$ Possible duplicates: physics.stackexchange.com/q/24068/2451 and links therein. $\endgroup$ –  Qmechanic ♦ Sep 26 '18 at 8:08
$\begingroup$ I don't think this is an opinion based question. $\endgroup$ –  user1379857 Sep 26 '18 at 11:06
$\begingroup$ @user1379857 You're right. I'll remove the close vote. $\endgroup$ –  John Rennie Sep 26 '18 at 11:34
$\begingroup$ @user1379857: It's not a duplicate of those questions, though. The answers to those questions explain why people don't like the many-worlds interpretation, but not why people don't think it's valid. $\endgroup$ –  knzhou Sep 26 '18 at 13:32
$\begingroup$ @knzhou the two are connected. The MWI is not valid because it is not a useful description of nature, and it is not useful because it is not predictive, and it is not predictive because it is not falsifiable. $\endgroup$ –  ZeroTheHero Sep 26 '18 at 13:40
The many-worlds interpretation (MWI) is not an interpretation of quantum mechanics, it is a modification of quantum mechanics. It's not a modification of quantum mechanics that is needed to describe any known experimental results. So why should anyone use it?

instruction: Does the 5 second rule actually exist?

The answer is yes, but not quite how you might think.
A 5 second rule is a term used to describe the amount of time you have to pick up food that has fallen on the ground and eat it before bacteria start to form. However, the 5 second rule is not set in stone and there are a number of factors that can affect how long you have to pick up your food.
The first factor is the type of surface that your food has landed on. If your food has landed on a surface that is moist or has a lot of bacteria, such as a bathroom floor, then you will only have a few seconds to pick it up before bacteria starts to form. If your food has landed on a dry, clean surface, then you will have more time to pick it up.
The second factor is the type of food that you are picking up. Some foods, such as raw meat, are more likely to have bacteria on them than others. If you are picking up raw meat, you will only have a few seconds to pick it up before bacteria starts to form. If you are picking up a piece of fruit, you will have more time to pick it up.
The third factor is the temperature of the food. If the food is hot, it will have more bacteria on it than if it is cold. If you are picking up hot food, you will only have a few seconds to pick it up before bacteria starts to form. If you are picking up cold food, you will have more time to pick it up.
So, the 5 second rule is not a hard and fast rule. It is more of a guideline. If you are picking up food that has landed on a moist or dirty surface, you will only have a few seconds to pick it up before bacteria starts to form. If you are picking up food that has landed on a dry, clean surface, you will have more time to pick it up. And if you are picking up cold food, you will have more time to pick it up than if you are picking up hot food.

The advantage of a compiled language is that the program will run faster than an interpreted language, but the disadvantage is that you have to wait for the program to compile before you can execute it.
Interpreted languages are those that are executed directly by the computer. Examples include Perl, Python, and PHP. The advantage of an interpreted language is that you can execute the program immediately without having to wait for it to compile, but the disadvantage is that the program will run slower than a compiled language.
Just-in-time (JIT) languages are those that are compiled into machine code as they are executed. Examples include Java and C#. The advantage of a JIT language is that it combines the speed of a compiled language with the immediacy of an interpreted language. The disadvantage is that it can be slower than a compiled language because the program has to be compiled each time it is executed.

instruction: how does two factor authentication work?
output:
(2FA)
Two-factor authentication (2FA) is a method of confirming users' claimed identities by using a combination of two different factors: something they know, and something they have.
This is a good method of adding an extra layer of security to online accounts. It is more secure than single-factor authentication, which relies only on a user password or PIN.
The two factors are:
something the user knows, such as a password or PIN
something the user has, such as a security token or phone
For example, when you login to your online bank account, you will be asked for your username and password. This is the first factor. To complete the login, you will also need a one-time security code, which is sent to your mobile phone as a text message. This is the second factor.
This type of two-factor authentication is called "something you know and something you have".
Another type of two-factor authentication is "something you know and something you are". This uses biometric data, such as a fingerprint or iris scan, as the second factor.
Two-factor authentication can also be used for online transactions. For example, when you make a purchase with your credit card, you will be asked for your card number, expiration date, and security code. This is the first factor. To complete the transaction, you will also need a one-time security code, which is sent to your mobile phone as a text message. This is the second factor.
Two-factor authentication is a good way to add an extra layer of security to your online accounts. It is more secure than single-factor authentication, which relies only on a password or PIN.

output:
in multiple columns

How to find duplicate values in multiple columns in SQL?

To find duplicate values in multiple columns in SQL, you can use the GROUP BY clause to group the rows by the values in the columns, and then use the HAVING clause to filter out rows with duplicate values. Here is an example:

Example:
```
SELECT column1, column2, COUNT(*) AS count
FROM table_name
GROUP BY column1, column2
HAVING COUNT(*) > 1
ORDER BY count DESC;
```
In this example, the query first selects the values in column1 and column2 from the table_name. It then groups the rows by the values in these two columns using the GROUP BY clause. The HAVING clause is then used to filter out rows with duplicate values, and the COUNT() function is used to count the number of rows in each group. Finally, the results are sorted by the count in descending order using the ORDER BY clause.

This query will return all rows with duplicate values in column1 and column2, along with the number of rows in each group.

instruction: Design a skill assessment questioner for R (Programming Language).
output:
This questioner will be used for assessing the skill of the candidates. This is an important questioner as it will be used for assessing the skill of the candidates. The questioner should be well designed and the questions should be relevant and appropriate.
R is a programming language for statistical computing and graphics. It is a free and open source software that is widely used in data analysis, data visualization, and machine learning. R is a powerful tool for data analysis and it is used by researchers, analysts, and data scientists around the world.
The skill assessment questioner should be designed to test the candidate’s understanding of the basic concepts of R, such as variables, data types, functions, and operators. The questioner should also test the candidate’s ability to work with data in R, such as importing and exporting data, manipulating data, and creating plots and graphs.
Some of the questions that can be included in the skill assessment questioner are:
What is the difference between a vector and a matrix in R?
How do you create a vector in R?
How do you import data from a CSV file in R?
How do you manipulate data in R?
How do you create a plot in R?
How do you create a graph in R?
The questioner should also include questions that test the candidate’s ability to use advanced features of R, such as functions, packages, and data structures. The questioner should be designed to test the candidate’s ability to solve real-world problems using R.
In conclusion, the skill assessment questioner for R should be designed to test the candidate’s understanding of the basic concepts of R, as well as their ability to work with data and create plots and graphs. The questioner should also test the candidate’s ability to use advanced features of R to solve real-world problems. The questioner should be well designed and the questions should be relevant and appropriate.

instruction: Write a template for First-Person LinkedIn profile summary.
output:
First-person LinkedIn profile summary is a summary of your work history. It is a one-paragraph summary of your work history and accomplishments. It is a way to introduce yourself to potential employers and to showcase your skills and experience. It is also a way to show that you are a good fit for the job.
Here are some tips for writing a first-person LinkedIn profile summary:
Use active verbs. Use active verbs to describe your accomplishments. For example, instead of saying “I managed a team of 10 people,” say “I led a team of 10 people to achieve a 20% increase in sales.”
Use numbers. Use numbers to show the impact of your accomplishments. For example, instead of saying “I increased sales by 20%,” say “I increased sales by 20% in the last quarter.”
Use specific examples. Use specific examples to show how you achieved your accomplishments. For example, instead of saying “I managed a team of 10 people,” say “I managed a team of 10 people and we achieved a 20% increase in sales.”
Use keywords. Use keywords that are relevant to the job you are applying for. For example, if you are applying for a marketing job, use keywords such as “marketing,” “advertising,” and “social media.”
Here is a template for a first-person LinkedIn profile summary:
As a [job title], I have [number of years of experience] years of experience in [industry]. I am a [adjective] professional with a proven track record of [accomplishment]. I am skilled in [skill 1], [skill 2], and [skill 3]. I am looking for a new challenge and am excited to contribute my skills and experience to a new organization.
Here is an example of a first-person LinkedIn profile summary:
As a marketing manager, I have 5 years of experience in the marketing industry. I am a creative and innovative professional with a proven track record of increasing sales by 20% in the last quarter. I am skilled in social media marketing, email marketing, and content marketing. I am looking for a new challenge and am excited to contribute my skills and experience to a new organization.

instruction:
Give examples of popular shows and movies in the genre.

Genre: Crime TV Shows
output:
1. Law & Order: Special Victims Unit (2000)
The Special Victims Unit, a specially trained squad of detectives in the NYPD, investigate sexually related crimes.
2. Elementary (2012)
A modern take on the cases of Sherlock Holmes, with the detective now living in New York City.
3. The Mentalist (2008)
A former consultant for the FBI, now in private practice and working on mainly cases involving missing persons, is called upon by his old boss in Washington to help track down his nemesis, serial killer Red John.
4. Criminal Minds (2005)
The cases of the F.B.I. Behavioral Analysis Unit (B.A.U.), an elite group of profilers who analyze the nation's most dangerous serial killers and individual heinous crimes in an effort to anticipate their next moves before they strike again.
5. True Detective (2014)
Following the conclusion of the case in California, former LAPD detective Rust Cohle (Matthew McConaughey) and ex-cop Marty Hart (Woody Harrelson) are living separate lives. Cohle has left the police force and is now a Louisiana State Police homicide detective, while Hart is a family man living in Ruston, Louisiana. The two are brought back together by the reopening of a case from 1995, when Hart was still a detective in Louisiana. The two are assigned to work together again, and the investigation leads them to a cult. 

Genre: Crime Movies
1. The Dark Knight (2008)
When the menace known as the Joker wreaks havoc and chaos on the people of Gotham, the caped crusader must come to terms with one of the greatest psychological tests of his ability to fight injustice.
2. The Godfather (1972)
The aging patriarch of an organized crime dynasty transfers control of his clandestine empire to his reluctant son.
3. The Departed (2006)
An undercover cop and a mole in the police attempt to identify each other while infiltrating an Irish gang in South Boston.
4. The Silence of the Lambs (1991)
A young F.B.I. cadet must confide in an incarcerated and manipulative killer to receive his help on catching another serial killer who skins his victims.
5. Pulp Fiction (1994)
The lives of two mob hit men, a boxer, a gangster's wife, and a pair of diner bandits intertwine in four tales of violence and redemption.

He wears his airpods in the car and around the accommodation - not that I've kept trying to talk to him. Honestly, he is bringing some seriously bad vibes to everything and it's ruining my trip.
We don't have anything booked in yet for the South Island, so I'm planning to ditch him in Wellington at the ferry. Probably book my own car in Picton and just relax alone for the rest of the trip. Another repeat visit and no disappointment from us. Great place for breakfast or brunch - and you won't need to eat again for awhile. The restaurant is close to the Tenderloin so be aware of your surroundings.
We enjoyed the Succotash Omelet (at least my wife enjoyed it), the Pulled Pork Benedict and the Hangtown Fry. Portions are large and pricing is fair. I wish we could have managed a Beignet Flight!
Definitely a spot to seek out. It can be crowed at times so be patient. Well worth any wait.
output:
You will not be disappointed.
This is our second visit and it did not disappoint. We were seated quickly, and our server was very pleasant and attentive. We ordered the biscuits and gravy, which were very good. My wife ordered the eggs Benedict, which were also very good. I had the biscuits and gravy, which were good, but the gravy was a bit salty. The... More 
We were staying at the Hotel Zetta across the street and walked over for breakfast. It was a very busy Sunday morning, but we only waited 5 minutes for a table. The food was good, and the service was good. I would definitely recommend it.
Great breakfast, service, and atmosphere. I had the French toast, and my boyfriend had the biscuits and gravy. We both enjoyed our meals, and our waiter was great. Would definitely come back.

Here you will find videos and content that will help students prepare for the application process to graduate schools as well as how to apply to graduate schools
output:
.

### Why should I go to graduate school?
When you think about graduate school, what comes to mind? Do you think about the financial investment? The time commitment? The opportunity cost? What about the potential benefits? The opportunities? The increased earning potential? The personal and professional growth? All of these questions are important to consider when thinking about graduate school. There are many reasons to go to graduate school, but you need to consider the reasons that are most important to you.

### What are the advantages of a graduate degree?
There are many advantages to obtaining a graduate degree. A graduate degree can help you advance your career, increase your earning potential, and provide you with a competitive edge in the job market. It can also provide you with the opportunity to explore your interests and passions, and to develop your skills and knowledge in a specific area. Additionally, a graduate degree can help you gain access to professional networks and resources, and can provide you with the opportunity to make a positive impact in your field.

### What are the disadvantages of a graduate degree?
There are several disadvantages to obtaining a graduate degree. First, it can be expensive. Tuition and fees for graduate school can be much higher than for undergraduate school, and many students need to take out loans to cover the cost. Second, graduate school can be time-consuming. It typically takes longer to complete a graduate degree than an undergraduate degree, and students may need to put their careers on hold while they pursue their studies. Third, graduate school can be stressful. The workload is often more demanding than in undergraduate school, and students may feel pressure to perform well in order to get into a good program or get a job after graduation. Finally, graduate school can be isolating. Students may feel like they are the only ones going through the process, and they may feel like they are the only ones struggling with the workload or the stress.

### What are some tips for choosing a graduate school?
When choosing a graduate school, it is important to consider the following:
1. The program's reputation. Make sure to research the program's reputation and see what other students and alumni have to say about their experience.
2. The program's curriculum. Make sure the program offers the courses you are interested in and that the curriculum is challenging and relevant.
3. The program's faculty. Make sure the program has experienced and knowledgeable faculty who are experts in their field.
4. The program's location. Consider the location of the program and whether it is convenient for you.
5. The program's cost.

instruction: Write a step-by-step guide for resolving GitHub merge conflicts.
output:
Include the following sections in your guide:
How to identify the conflict in the first place
How to use Git to resolve the conflict
How to commit the resolved changes
How to push the changes to GitHub
How to test the changes to ensure they are working as expected
Please provide detailed explanations and examples to help users understand the process.
How to Resolve GitHub Merge Conflicts
How to Resolve GitHub Merge Conflicts
In this article, we will guide you through the process of resolving GitHub merge conflicts. We will cover the following steps:
Step 1: Identify the Conflict
The first step in resolving a merge conflict is to identify the conflict. This can be done by checking the files that were changed in the two branches that were merged. If there are any files with conflicting changes, they will be marked as “CONFLICT (content)”.
Step 2: Resolve the Conflict
Once you have identified the conflict, you need to resolve it. This can be done by editing the files and resolving the conflicting changes. You can use a text editor to open the files and make the necessary changes. If you are not sure how to resolve the conflict, you can use a merge tool to help you.
Step 3: Commit the Changes
Once you have resolved the conflict, you need to commit the changes. This can be done by using the “git commit” command. You will need to provide a commit message that describes the changes you made to resolve the conflict.
Step 4: Push the Changes to GitHub
Once you have committed the changes, you need to push them to GitHub. This can be done by using the “git push” command. You will need to provide the name of the remote repository and the branch you want to push to.
Step 5: Test the Changes
Finally, you need to test the changes to ensure they are working as expected. This can be done by running the application or website and checking for any issues.
Resolving GitHub merge conflicts can be a challenging task, but with the right tools and techniques, it can be done. By following the steps outlined in this article, you can resolve merge conflicts quickly and efficiently.

instruction:
Give a brief summary of the movie or series' plot.

Breaking Bad (TV Series 2008–2013)
output:
- IMDb

Breaking Bad is an American crime drama television series created and produced by Vince Gilligan. The show originally aired on the cable network AMC in the United States from January 20, 2008, to September 29, 2013, consisting of five seasons for a total of 62 episodes. The show tells the story of Walter White (Bryan Cranston), a struggling high school chemistry teacher diagnosed with inoperable lung cancer. To secure his family's financial future, Walter pairs with former student Jesse Pinkman (Aaron Paul) to enter the methamphetamine business. The series follows the characters' efforts to escape their pasts while maintaining their business dealings, as well as their moral decline. Breaking Bad became a critical success, garnering numerous awards and nominations. It has been listed on numerous critics' best television series lists, ranking first on the Writers Guild of America's list of the 101 Best Written TV Series of All Time. The series finale earned the series the highest Nielsen rating for an original series finale in cable television history.

The series was filmed primarily at Manhattan Beach Studios in California. The series was first conceived in 2007, with Gilligan originally envisioning a six-episode run. After the first season, the show was renewed for a second season of 13 episodes, followed by third and fourth seasons of 13 episodes each. The final season was extended to 16 episodes, with a total of 62 airing over the course of the series. Breaking Bad has been broadcast in numerous countries worldwide, including Australia, Canada, Denmark, Ireland, Italy, Japan, Latin America, Mexico, the Netherlands, New Zealand, the United Kingdom, and the United States. The show received widespread critical acclaim, with many critics considering it one of the greatest television series of all time. The show has been nominated for numerous awards, including sixteen Primetime Emmy Awards, eight Satellite Awards, and eighteen Saturn Awards; winning five Primetime Emmy Awards, eight Satellite Awards, and ten Saturn Awards. The show also received a Peabody Award in 2013.

Breaking Bad is the highest-rated show in the history of cable television, and has been a commercial success for AMC, driving an increase in viewership for the network and an increase in revenue from advertisements. The series' fifth season was the most-watched series on cable in America, and internationally, the series has been shown in 204 territories, translated into 38 languages. instruction:
Provide a Java solution to the following problem.

Given an integer n, return true if it is a power of three. Otherwise, return false.
An integer n is a power of three, if there exists an integer x such that n == 3^x.

Example 1:
In: n = 27
Out: true
Explanation: 27 = 3^3

Example 2:
In: n = 0
Out: false
Explanation: There is no x where 3^x = 0.

Example 3:
In: n = -1
Out: false
Explanation: There is no x where 3x = (-1).
 
Constraints:
-231 <= n <= 231 - 1
Follow up: Could you solve it without loops/recursion?

Finally! After a while of shooting in the dark and frantically fiddling with sample inputs on the whiteboard, you've came up with an algorithm for solving the coding question your interviewer gave you.
Whew. Such a relief to have a clear path forward. To not be flailing anymore.
Now you're cruising, getting ready to code up your solution.
When suddenly, your interviewer throws you a curve ball.
"What if we thought of the problem this way?"
You feel a tension we've all felt during the coding interview:
"Try to listen to what they're saying...but don't lose your train of thought...ugh, I can't do both!"
output:
.
You're so close to writing your code, but now you're being asked to think about the problem differently.
How do you keep your train of thought while trying to understand the interviewer's point?
It's a lot to juggle. So many balls in the air. So many questions you want to ask. So many things you want to say.
But there's one thing you need to do above all else.
Listen.
As soon as your interviewer mentions a different perspective, it's critical that you slow down, take a breath, and listen to what they're saying.
And I'm not just talking about listening with your ears.
I'm talking about listening with your eyes.
Listen to the words they use.
Listen to the way they're saying them.
Listen to their tone.
Listen to their facial expressions.
Listen to their body language.
Listen to everything about them.
Because by doing that, you're not just listening to the words they're saying.
You're listening to their perspective.
And that perspective is what you need to understand in order to solve the problem.
So when your interviewer says something like, "What if we thought of the problem this way?", you need to pause, take a breath, and listen to what they're saying.
Because that's how you'll understand their perspective.
And that's how you'll be able to solve the problem.
Don't rush through the interview.
Take your time.
Listen.
Understand.
And then you'll be able to solve the problem.

instruction:
You are given a programming problem and its implementation. Analyze the problem and implementation and explain the algorithm and approach used to solve the problem.

Table: Person
| Column Name | Type     |
| personId          | int         |
| lastName         | varchar |
| firstName         | varchar |
personId is the primary key column for this table.
This table contains information about the ID of some persons and their first and last names.
Table: Address
| Column Name | Type     |
| addressId        | int         |
| personId          | int         |
| city                   | varchar|
| state                | varchar |
addressId is the primary key column for this table.
Each row of this table contains information about the city and state of one person with ID = PersonId.
Write an SQL query to report the first name, last name, city, and state of each person in the Person table. If the address of a personId is not present in the Address table, report null instead.
Return the result table in any order.
Implementation:
select FirstName, LastName, City, State
from Person left join Address
on Person.PersonId = Address.PersonId
;

instruction:
Summarize the article you have been given in a brief manner.

Mathematics and art are related in a variety of ways. Mathematics has itself been described as an art motivated by beauty. Mathematics can be discerned in arts such as music, dance, painting, architecture, sculpture, and textiles. This article focuses, however, on mathematics in the visual arts.
Mathematics and art have a long historical relationship. Artists have used mathematics since the 4th century BC when the Greek sculptor Polykleitos wrote his Canon, prescribing proportions conjectured to have been based on the ratio 1:√2 for the ideal male nude. Persistent popular claims have been made for the use of the golden ratio in ancient art and architecture, without reliable evidence. In the Italian Renaissance, Luca Pacioli wrote the influential treatise De divina proportione (1509), illustrated with woodcuts by Leonardo da Vinci, on the use of the golden ratio in art. Another Italian painter, Piero della Francesca, developed Euclid's ideas on perspective in treatises such as De Prospectiva Pingendi, and in his paintings. The engraver Albrecht Dürer made many references to mathematics in his work Melencolia I. In modern times, the graphic artist M. C. Escher made intensive use of tessellation and hyperbolic geometry, with the help of the mathematician H. S. M. Coxeter, while the De Stijl movement led by Theo van Doesburg and Piet Mondrian explicitly embraced geometrical forms. Mathematics has inspired textile arts such as quilting, knitting, cross-stitch, crochet, embroidery, weaving, Turkish and other carpet-making, as well as kilim. In Islamic art, symmetries are evident in forms as varied as Persian girih and Moroccan zellige tilework, Mughal jali pierced stone screens, and widespread muqarnas vaulting.

Some 20th-century artists have exhibited a profound interest in mathematical concepts. This may result in works such as a computer-aided sculpture with a shape dictated by chaotic variation, or the use of groups in expressionist painting.

The "fair trade" movement, also known as the "trade justice" movement, promotes the use of labour, environmental and social standards for the production of commodities, particularly those exported from the Third and Second Worlds to the First World. Such ideas have also sparked a debate on whether trade itself should be codified as a human right.
output:
The fair trade movement has its origins in the European and American development movement of the 1940s and 1950s. It has been described as an outgrowth of the development movement in Europe and the United States, which was a response to the failures of development aid to Third World countries in the 1950s and 1960s.[1] The movement has been a response to the exploitation of Third World workers by First World companies.

The fair trade movement began as a grass-roots movement in the 1950s, but has grown into a global movement with many organizations involved in the production, importation, and distribution of fair trade products. These organizations include small and large businesses, as well as non-profit organizations.

Dentistry, also known as dental medicine and oral medicine, is the branch of medicine focused on the teeth, gums, and mouth. It consists of the study, diagnosis, prevention, management, and treatment of diseases, disorders, and conditions of the mouth, most commonly focused on dentition (the development and arrangement of teeth) as well as the oral mucosa. Dentistry may also encompass other aspects of the craniofacial complex including the temporomandibular joint. The practitioner is called a dentist.

instruction:
Please answer the following question based on the information provided in the article.

Development studies is an interdisciplinary branch of social science. Development studies is offered as a specialized master's degree in a number of reputed universities around the world. It has grown in popularity as a subject of study since the early 1990s, and has been most widely taught and researched in developing countries and countries with a colonial history, such as the UK, where the discipline originated.  Students of development studies often choose careers in international organisations such as the United Nations, World Bank, non-governmental organisations (NGOs), media and journalism houses, private sector development consultancy firms, corporate social responsibility (CSR) bodies and research centers.
What are some popular careers for students of development studies?
output:
A. Humanitarian aid workers 
B. Government officials 
C. Journalists 
D. All of the above


Answer: D
Explanation: Development studies is an interdisciplinary branch of social science. Development studies is offered as a specialized master's degree in a number of reputed universities around the world. It has grown in popularity as a subject of study since the early 1990s, and has been most widely taught and researched in developing countries and countries with a colonial history, such as the UK, where the discipline originated.  Students of development studies often choose careers in international organisations such as the United Nations, World Bank, non-governmental organisations (NGOs), media and journalism houses, private sector development consultancy firms, corporate social responsibility (CSR) bodies and research centers.
A Humanitarian aid workers work to provide relief and assistance to those affected by natural disasters, armed conflicts, and other crises. They often work for international organizations such as the United Nations, World Food Programme, or the International Committee of the Red Cross. Humanitarian aid workers may also work for NGOs or local organizations.
B Government officials work for government agencies and departments. They may work in areas such as foreign affairs, defense, education, health, or finance. Government officials may also work for international organizations such as the United Nations or the World Bank.
C Journalists work in the media and journalism houses. They report on current events and issues in the world. Journalists may work for newspapers, magazines, radio stations, or television networks.
D All of the above are popular careers for students of development studies.

instruction:
Create a daily itinerary based on the given information.

Our family is looking for a 9-day Morocco trip that has light to moderate activity levels.
output:
We want to stay in nice hotels, but we also want to experience the local culture. We are interested in seeing the cities of Fez and Marrakech, as well as some smaller towns along the way. We would like to have a tour guide to help us navigate the cities and provide some context for the sites we see. We would also like to have some time to relax and enjoy the local cuisine.

Based on this information, here is a suggested daily itinerary for our Morocco trip:

Day 1: Arrive in Casablanca and check into our hotel. Spend the afternoon exploring the city on our own.

Day 2: Take a guided tour of Casablanca, including the Hassan II Mosque and the Corniche.

Day 3: Drive to Fez and check into our hotel. Spend the afternoon exploring the city on our own.

Day 4: Take a guided tour of Fez, including the Medina and the Jewish Quarter.

Day 5: Drive to Chefchaouen and check into our hotel. Spend the afternoon exploring the city on our own.

Day 6: Take a guided tour of Chefchaouen, including the Medina and the Kasbah.

Day 7: Drive to Marrakech and check into our hotel. Spend the afternoon exploring the city on our own.

Day 8: Take a guided tour of Marrakech, including the Medina and the souks.

Day 9: Depart for home.

instruction:

Steam Engine Using an Empty Beer Can

Project Goals

• Create a working steam engine.
• Investigate the effect of the size of the can on the speed of the engine.
• Investigate the effect of the amount of water on the speed of the engine.
• Investigate the effect of the temperature of the water on the speed of the engine.
• Investigate the effect of the amount of air in the can on the speed of the engine.

Materials

• 2 empty beer cans
• 2 rubber bands
• 2 straight pins
• 2 paper clips
• 2 cups
• 2 thermometers
• 2 rulers
• 1 digital camera
• 1 computer with Internet connection

Steps

1. Use the ruler to measure the diameter of the can. Record the measurement in a data table. The diameter is the distance from one side of the can to the opposite side. (See Figure 1.)

Figure 1. Measuring the diameter of the can.

2. Calculate the area of the can. Use the formula A = πr2, where A is the area of the can, r is the radius of the can, and π is a constant equal to approximately 3.14. (See Figure 2.)

Figure 2. Measuring the radius of the can.

3. Calculate the circumference of the can. Use the formula C = 2πr, where C is the circumference of the can, r is the radius of the can, and π is a constant equal to approximately 3.14. (See Figure 3.)

Figure 3. Measuring the circumference of the can.

4. Make a data table in which you record the diameter, area, and circumference of the can.

5. Measure the radius of the can using the ruler. (See Figure 2.)

6. Use the ruler to measure the length of the straight pin. (See Figure 4.)

Figure 4. Measuring the length of the straight pin.

7. Cut the pin to the same length as the circumference of the can.

8. Use the straight pin to poke two holes in the can, one at the top and one at the bottom. The holes should be opposite each other. (See Figure 5.)

Figure 5. Drilling holes in the can.

9. Insert the straight pin into the top hole and bend it around the can so that it forms a loop. (See Figure 6.)

Figure 6. Looping the pin.

10. Insert the straight pin

From a chicken stir fry to a salmon, these 5 easy recipes are sure to please the entire family.
Easy dinner ideas for weeknights
Are you tired of the same old dinner recipes? Do you want to try something new and exciting? Look no further than these easy dinner ideas for weeknights. These recipes are quick, easy, and delicious, perfect for busy weeknights when you don’t have a lot of time to cook. Whether you’re in the mood for a hearty casserole or a light and refreshing salad, these recipes have you covered. So why not give them a try and add some variety to your weeknight dinners? Your taste buds will thank you.
1. Easy Chicken Stir Fry
This easy chicken stir fry is a delicious and healthy meal that is perfect for busy weeknights. It’s made with chicken, vegetables, and a flavorful sauce that comes together in just 30 minutes. The best part is that you can customize the recipe with your favorite vegetables and adjust the spice level to your liking. Serve it over rice or noodles for a complete meal that is sure to please the whole family.
2. Salmon with Lemon and Dill
This salmon with lemon and dill is a simple yet flavorful dish that is perfect for a weeknight dinner. The salmon is cooked to perfection and the combination of lemon and dill gives it a refreshing and zesty flavor. Serve it with a side of roasted vegetables or a salad for a complete and satisfying meal.
3. One Pan Chicken and Veggies
This one pan chicken and veggies is a healthy and delicious meal that is perfect for busy weeknights. It’s made with chicken, vegetables, and a few simple spices that come together in just 30 minutes. The best part is that it’s all cooked in one pan, making cleanup a breeze. Serve it with a side of rice or pasta for a complete meal that is sure to please the whole family.
4. Quinoa and Black Bean Salad
This quinoa and black bean salad is a healthy and delicious meal that is perfect for a light lunch or dinner. It’s made with quinoa, black beans, and a variety of vegetables that come together in just 30 minutes. The best part is that it’s packed with protein and fiber, making it a filling and satisfying meal. Serve it with a side of avocado or a slice of whole grain bread for a complete and balanced meal.

Whether you’re hosting a Super Bowl party or a family game night, having snacks on hand is essential. After all, no one wants to play a game on an empty stomach!
In this article, we’ll share some of our favorite game day snacks and party foods that are sure to please everyone. We’ve got everything from classic favorites like nachos and chili to more unique options like buffalo chicken dip and jalapeno poppers.
So, whether you’re looking for something easy to make or something that will impress your guests, we’ve got you covered. Keep reading for our top game day snack ideas!

Buffalo chicken dip is a creamy and spicy dip made with chicken, cream cheese, and buffalo sauce. It’s perfect for parties and game days, and it’s sure to be a hit with everyone!
To make buffalo chicken dip, start by cooking and shredding chicken. Then, mix the chicken with cream cheese, buffalo sauce, and ranch dressing. Add in some shredded cheese and mix well.
Bake the dip in the oven until it’s hot and bubbly, then serve with chips or crackers.

If you’re looking for a snack that’s both sweet and spicy, look no further than bacon-wrapped jalapenos! These little bites of heaven are sure to please everyone at your game day party.
To make bacon-wrapped jalapenos, start by cooking and draining a can of jalapenos. Then, wrap each jalapeno in a slice of bacon and secure with a toothpick.
Bake the jalapenos in the oven until the bacon is crispy, then brush them with a mixture of brown sugar and chili powder. Serve warm with a side of ranch dressing or blue cheese dressing.
3. Cheesy Bacon Ranch Pull-Apart Bread
If you’re looking for a snack that’s both cheesy and delicious, look no further than cheesy bacon ranch pull-apart bread! This easy-to-make snack is sure to please everyone at your game day party.
To make cheesy bacon ranch pull-apart bread, start by mixing together ranch dressing mix, cream cheese, and shredded cheddar cheese. Then, spread the mixture on a loaf of bread and top with bacon bits.
Bake the bread in the oven until it’s hot and bubbly, then slice and serve. This snack is sure to be a hit with everyone!

instruction:
Describe how to prepare the given food in your own words. Note down the ingredients you will need and the steps you will take to prepare them.

Chewy Chocolate Chip Cookies
output:
Ingredients:
2 cups all-purpose flour
1 teaspoon baking soda
1/2 teaspoon salt
1 cup (2 sticks) butter, softened
1 cup granulated sugar
1/2 cup packed brown sugar
2 large eggs
2 teaspoons vanilla extract
1 cup semisweet chocolate chips

Steps:
1. Preheat oven to 375°F.
2. In a large bowl, whisk together flour, baking soda, and salt.
3. In a separate bowl, beat together butter and sugars until light and fluffy. Add eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition. Stir in vanilla extract.
4. Add dry ingredients to wet ingredients and mix until just combined. Stir in chocolate chips.
5. Drop dough by rounded tablespoons onto ungreased baking sheets. Bake for 8-10 minutes, or until cookies are golden brown around the edges but still slightly soft in the center. Let cool on baking sheets for 2 minutes before transferring to wire racks to cool completely.

instruction:
Solve this equation.

x^3 - 4x^2 + 6x - 24 = 0
output:
1. Originally Posted by mackenzie

Solve this equation.

x^3 - 4x^2 + 6x - 24 = 0

Is there any reason you think this is a cubic equation?
The first thing I'd do is to try and factorize this polynomial:

x^3 - 4x^2 + 6x - 24 = (x - 2)(x^2 - 6x + 12)

Then we have:

x^3 - 4x^2 + 6x - 24 = (x - 2)(x^2 - 6x + 12)

= (x - 2)(x - 3)(x - 4)

3. Originally Posted by mackenzie

Solve this equation.

x^3 - 4x^2 + 6x - 24 = 0

Is there any reason you think this is a cubic equation?
The first thing I'd do is to try and factorize this polynomial:

x^3 - 4x^2 + 6x - 24 = (x - 2)(x^2 - 6x + 12)

Then we have:

x^3 - 4x^2 + 6x - 24 = (x - 2)(x^2 - 6x + 12)

= (x - 2)(x - 3)(x - 4)
There's a much easier way to factorize this polynomial:

x^3 - 4x^2 + 6x - 24 = x^3 - 4x^2 + 4x - 24 + 2x

= x(x^2 - 4x + 4) + 2x

= x(x - 2)^2 + 2x

= (x - 2)(x^2 - 2x + 2)

= (x - 2)(x - 1)(x - 2)

= (x - 2)^2(x - 1)

4. Originally Posted by mackenzie

Solve this equation.

x^3 - 4x^2 + 6x - 24 = 0
Hi, mackenzie!

You have a quadratic equation, and you can solve it by factoring.

$x^3 - 4x^2 + 6x - 24 \:=\:0$

Let $k \in \mathbb{Z}$. Then, by the fact, $k^2 \ge 0$.

Thus, $k^2 + 2k + 1 \ge 0 + 2k + 1 = 2k + 1$.

Now, if $k \ge 0$, then $2k + 1 \ge 1$.

If $k \le 0$, then $2k + 1 \ge -1$.

Thus, in either case, $2k + 1 \ge 0$, and so $k^2 + 2k + 1 \ge 0$.

Provide a formula for computing the nth term in the given sequence

5, 14, 23, 32, 41, ...
output:
, n

I know the formula is $$f(n) = 5 + 9(n - 1)$$

I know that the formula for the sequence is $$f(n) = 5 + 9(n - 1)$$

How would I go about computing the nth term in the given sequence?

• If you know the formula, what is stopping you from computing the $n$-th term? – Arthur May 19 '19 at 19:44
• @Arthur I don't know how to plug in the $n$ into the formula. – user697777 May 19 '19 at 19:44
• Then you should read the question again. – Arthur May 19 '19 at 19:45
• @Arthur I'm sorry. I'm still a bit confused. – user697777 May 19 '19 at 19:45
• @user697777 Just plug in $n$ for $n$ and you are done. – Peter May 19 '19 at 19:46

$$f(n)=5+9(n-1)$$

So, plug in $$n$$

$$f(n)=5+9(n-1)$$

$$=5+9n-9$$

$$=9n-4$$

So, if $$n=10$$, $$f(n)=9(10)-4=86$$

I hope it helps.

• It's not 9n-4, it's 9n-4, sorry – user697777 May 19 '19 at 19:48
• It's still 9n-4 – user697777 May 19 '19 at 19:49
• Oh, sorry, I edited it – Peter May 19 '19 at 19:49
• Thanks for the help! – user697777 May 19 '19 at 19:49
• You're welcome. – Peter May 19 '19 at 19:50

If you know the formula, then you know that the $$n$$-th term is

$$f(n) = 5 + 9(n-1)$$

So all you have to do is plug in $$n$$:

$$f(n) = 5 + 9(n-1)$$ $$= 5 + 9n - 9$$ $$= 9n - 4$$

instruction:
Create a table listing all games that meet the specified criteria in the National Football League. Use the season, local time, game, and score as columns of the table.

Ravens home games in 2011
output:
The following query uses the filter() function to list all games for the Ravens at home in 2011.

SELECT
  season,
  local_time,
  game,
  score
FROM nfl_games
WHERE team = 'BAL'
  AND home_away = 'H'
  AND season = '2011'
ORDER BY season, local_time, game

The following query uses the filter() function to list all games for the Ravens at home in 2011 and the final score was a tie.

SELECT
  season,
  local_time,
  game,
  score
FROM nfl_games
WHERE team = 'BAL'
  AND home_away = 'H'
  AND season = '2011'
  AND score = 'T'
ORDER BY season, local_time, game

The following query uses the filter() function to list all games for the Ravens at home in 2011 and the final score was a tie.

SELECT
  season,
  local_time,
  game,
  score
FROM nfl_games
WHERE team = 'BAL'
  AND home_away = 'H'
  AND season = '2011'
  AND score = 'T'
ORDER BY season, local_time, game

instruction:
Describe the content of the article in a brief manner.

A study published earlier this year by Zee and her team examined the role of light in sleep for healthy adults in their 20s. Sleeping for only one night with a dim light, such as a TV set with the sound off, raised the blood sugar and heart rate of the young people during the sleep lab experiment. An elevated heart rate at night has been shown in prior studies to be a risk factor for future heart disease and early death, while higher blood sugar levels are a sign of insulin resistance, which can ultimately lead to type 2 diabetes.
output:
This was the first study to show that a single night of disrupted sleep, even in young, healthy adults, can lead to these changes, Zee said. The study was published in the Journal of Clinical Endocrinology and Metabolism.

The researchers also found that when the young adults were exposed to dim light while sleeping, their bodies' production of melatonin, a hormone that helps regulate the body's internal clock and sleep, was significantly disrupted. Melatonin levels rose later at night and fell earlier in the morning than when the young adults slept in a dark room. This shift in the production of melatonin may explain why the young adults experienced changes in their blood sugar and heart rate when exposed to dim light while sleeping, Zee said.

instruction:
Describe the responsibilities of the given job.

Security Officer
output:
A security officer is responsible for the security of a building or an area. He or she may work for a company, government, or non-profit organization. The security officer’s job is to ensure that the people and property in the building or area are safe. The security officer may be responsible for checking the identification of people who enter the building or area, checking for weapons, and patrolling the area to ensure that no one is trespassing.

To become a security officer, one must have a high school diploma or equivalent. Some security officers may have a college degree. Most security officers must complete a training program. The training program may include instruction in the use of weapons, first aid, and how to use security equipment.

Security officers may work in a variety of settings, including office buildings, shopping malls, airports, and government buildings. They may also work in private homes or businesses. The hours of work for a security officer may vary depending on the location. Some security officers may work nights, weekends, or holidays.

The salary for a security officer varies depending on the location and the employer. The median annual salary for a security officer in the United States is $33,000.

instruction:
Give a brief explanation of the requested part of the paper.

Paper: The dominant sequence transduction models are based on complex recurrent or convolutional neural networks that include an encoder and a decoder. The best performing models also connect the encoder and decoder through an attention mechanism. We propose a new simple network architecture, the Transformer, based solely on attention mechanisms, dispensing with recurrence and convolutions entirely. Experiments on two machine translation tasks show these models to be superior in quality while being more parallelizable and requiring significantly less time to train. Our model achieves 28.4 BLEU on the WMT 2014 English-to-German translation task, improving over the existing best results, including ensembles, by over 2 BLEU. On the WMT 2014 English-to-French translation task, our model establishes a new single-model state-of-the-art BLEU score of 41.8 after training for 3.5 days on eight GPUs, a small fraction of the training costs of the best models from the literature. We show that the Transformer generalizes well to other tasks by applying it successfully to English constituency parsing both with large and limited training data.

instruction:
Extract the method that has been used in the research from the abstract of the paper. Give the exact sentences from the abstract that discuss the method.

We present a state-of-the-art speech recognition system developed using end-to-end deep learning. Our architecture is significantly simpler than traditional speech systems, which rely on laboriously engineered processing pipelines; these traditional systems also tend to perform poorly when used in noisy environments. In contrast, our system does not need hand-designed components to model background noise, reverberation, or speaker variation, but instead directly learns a function that is robust to such effects. We do not need a phoneme dictionary, nor even the concept of a "phoneme." Key to our approach is a well-optimized RNN training system that uses multiple GPUs, as well as a set of novel data synthesis techniques that allow us to efficiently obtain a large amount of varied data for training. Our system, called Deep Speech, outperforms previously published results on the widely studied Switchboard Hub5'00, achieving 16.0% error on the full test set. Deep Speech also handles challenging noisy environments better than widely used, state-of-the-art commercial speech systems.Collapse

instruction:
Create a short, concise summary of the paper based on its abstract.

Few-shot learning (FSL) is one of the key future steps in machine learning and raises a lot of attention. In this paper, we focus on the FSL problem of dialogue understanding, which contains two closely related tasks: intent detection and slot filling. Dialogue understanding has been proven to benefit a lot from jointly learning the two sub-tasks. However, such joint learning becomes challenging in the few-shot scenarios: on the one hand, the sparsity of samples greatly magnifies the difficulty of modeling the connection between the two tasks; on the other hand, how to jointly learn multiple tasks in the few-shot setting is still less investigated. In response to this, we introduce FewJoint, the first FSL benchmark for joint dialogue understanding. FewJoint provides a new corpus with 59 different dialogue domains from real industrial API and a code platform to ease FSL experiment set-up, which are expected to advance the research of this field. Further, we find that insufficient performance of the few-shot setting often leads to noisy sharing between two sub-task and disturbs joint learning. To tackle this, we guide slot with explicit intent information and propose a novel trust gating mechanism that blocks low-confidence intent information to ensure high quality sharing. Besides, we introduce a Reptile-based meta-learning strategy to achieve better generalization in unseen few-shot domains. In the experiments, the proposed method brings significant improvements on two datasets and achieve new state-of-the-art performance.
output:
Our code and dataset are released at https://github.com/hpcaitech/FewJoint.

A new state-of-the-art performance is achieved.

## Introduction

Few-shot learning (FSL) aims to learn a model from a few labeled samples in a new domain. It is a challenging task because of the lack of sufficient labeled data to train the model. The model is required to generalize well to the unseen few-shot domains. In the real-world scenario, there are many unseen domains, such as new products, new companies, and new languages. The model should be able to learn these domains with a few samples. FSL is an important research topic in machine learning and has attracted a lot of attention.

In this paper, we focus on the FSL problem of dialogue understanding, which contains two closely related tasks: intent detection and slot filling. Dialogue understanding has been proven to benefit a lot from jointly learning the two sub-tasks. However, such joint learning becomes challenging in the few-shot scenarios: on the one hand, the sparsity of samples greatly magnifies the difficulty of modeling the connection between the two tasks; on the other hand, how to jointly learn multiple tasks in the few-shot setting is still less investigated.

To tackle these challenges, we introduce FewJoint, the first FSL benchmark for joint dialogue understanding. FewJoint provides a new corpus with 59 different dialogue domains from real industrial API and a code platform to ease FSL experiment set-up, which are expected to advance the research of this field. Further, we find that insufficient performance of the few-shot setting often leads to noisy sharing between two sub-task and disturbs joint learning. To tackle this, we guide slot with explicit intent information and propose a novel trust gating mechanism that blocks low-confidence intent information to ensure high quality sharing. Besides, we introduce a Reptile-based meta-learning strategy to achieve better generalization in unseen few-shot domains. In the experiments, the proposed method brings significant improvements on two datasets and achieve new state-of-the-art performance. Our code and dataset are released at https://github.com/hpcaitech/FewJoint.

Create a list of subtopics for the given topic.

Music theory
output:
is the study of the practices and possibilities of music. The Oxford Companion to Music describes three interrelated uses of the term "music theory":

1. any general philosophical discourse about music that is separate from the practice of criticism, and
2. any systematic study of the practices of musicians, including the analysis and organization of all aspects of music, theory, history, and practice, and
3. the body of principles underlying the practice of composition, performance, and analysis of music.

Music theory is frequently concerned with describing and analysing how composers make music, and how listeners respond to it. It is applied in composition, performance, and musicology. The term music theory may also refer to a complete body of knowledge or belief, for instance the Music of the Spheres known to the Pythagoreans, or to a general study of how music itself works. Music theory can also refer to the study of techniques and practices to be used by a composer to create music.

Music theory can be learned from books, but can also be learned through listening to and analyzing music. Music theory is taught as an academic subject such as a music class in education or in a music lesson with an individual teacher. It is used by composers and musicians to acquire and develop the skills and knowledge related to composition, songwriting, rhythm, harmony, melody, form, instruments, and other aspects of music.

## Theory

### Western

The theoretical study of music is called music theory, and there are many different approaches to it.

#### Medieval and Renaissance

The earliest treatises on music theory were written in the Middle East, by Al-Kindi (Alkindus) in the 9th century, and by Al-Farabi (Alpharabius) in the 10th century. Music theory developed differently in the East and in the West. The main difference was that the East used a diatonic scale, while the West used a chromatic scale.

In the 10th century, a Greek priest named Guido d'Arezzo created a system of musical notation, called the hexachord. This system allowed singers to learn the melody of a song by reading the notes, and to sing in tune. The hexachord was a diatonic scale, which means that it had seven notes, and the first six notes were the same as the notes in the modern major scale. The seventh note was the same as the first note, but an octave higher. The hexachord was used by Guido d'Arezzo

# How to create a Jira ticket

## Introduction

This document is intended to serve as a guide for creating Jira tickets. It will provide an overview of the process, as well as some best practices to keep in mind while creating tickets. By following these guidelines, you can ensure that your tickets are clear and concise, making it easier for the team to understand and prioritize them.

## Scope

This guide will cover the following topics:

- Creating a Jira ticket
- Best practices for creating Jira tickets
- Tips for effective communication with the team

## Creating a Jira ticket

Creating a Jira ticket is a simple process. Here are the steps to follow:

1. Log in to Jira and navigate to the project you want to create a ticket for.
2. Click on the "Create" button in the top right corner of the screen.
3. Select the "Issue" option from the drop-down menu.
4. Fill in the relevant fields, such as the summary, description, and assignee.
5. Add any relevant attachments or links.
6. Click on the "Create" button to save the ticket.

## Best practices for creating Jira tickets

When creating a Jira ticket, there are a few best practices to keep in mind:

1. Keep it simple: Make sure your ticket is clear and concise. Use simple language and avoid jargon or technical terms that may not be familiar to the team.
2. Be specific: Provide as much detail as possible about the issue or feature you are requesting. This will help the team understand what needs to be done and how to prioritize the ticket.
3. Use labels and components: Use labels and components to categorize your tickets and make it easier for the team to find and prioritize them.
4. Include relevant attachments: If you have any relevant files or links, make sure to attach them to the ticket. This will provide additional context and help the team understand the issue or feature in more detail.

## Tips for effective communication with the team

Effective communication is key to a successful Jira ticket creation process. Here are a few tips to keep in mind:

1. Be proactive: If you have any questions or concerns about a ticket, don't hesitate to ask. The team is here to help and will be happy to provide clarification or assistance.
2. Use the comment section: If you have any additional information or updates to provide

instruction: For a quick and efficient office workout, suggest a short routine.
output:
This can be done during a break or lunch time. A simple routine may be something like the following: 10 sit ups, 10 push ups, 10 squats, 10 lunges (each leg), 10 jumping jacks, and 10 crunches. This routine is short and effective. It can be repeated several times during the day, as needed.
What are some good office exercises?
Some good office exercises include:
Walking or jogging in place.
Marching in place.
Squats with a chair or wall for support.
Lunges with a chair or wall for support.
Push-ups against a wall or desk.
Planks on the floor or against a wall.
Chair dips or tricep dips.
Calf raises with a chair or wall for support.
What are the best office exercises for weight loss?
The best office exercises for weight loss are those that are high intensity and can be done in a short amount of time. Some good options include:
High knees: This is a great cardio exercise that can be done in a small space. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and lift one knee up towards your chest, then lower it back down. Repeat on the other side.
Jumping jacks: This classic exercise is a great way to get your heart rate up. Stand with your feet together and jump up, spreading your legs wide as you land. Repeat.
Mountain climbers: This exercise is a great way to work your abs and legs. Start in a plank position and bring one knee up towards your chest, then switch legs. Repeat.
Burpees: This exercise is a full-body workout that will get your heart rate up and help you burn calories. Start in a standing position, then drop down into a squat, place your hands on the ground, and jump your feet back into a plank position. Jump your feet back up to your hands and stand up.
What are some effective office exercises for weight loss?
There are many effective office exercises for weight loss. Some examples include:
Walking: This is a great way to get in some exercise during your workday. You can walk around your office or take a break to walk outside. Even a short walk can help you burn calories and lose weight.
Jogging: This is another great way to get in some exercise during your workday. You can jog in place or outside. Jogging can help you burn calories and lose weight.
Cycling: This is a great way to get in some exercise during your workday. You can cycle to work

instruction:

school will _keep through the winter
output:
.

A. adjective
B. adverb
C. noun
D. pronoun
Answer: B
Explanation: There are nine parts of speech. The parts of speech are nouns, pronouns, adjectives, verbs, adverbs, prepositions, conjunctions, interjections, and articles.
An article is a short word that is used in front of a noun. There are two articles: the and a/an.
The and a/an are both called "a" in conversation.
A/an is used with a noun that begins with a consonant sound or a vowel sound that is pronounced like a consonant sound.
The is used with a noun that begins with a vowel sound that is pronounced like a vowel sound.
A banana is a fruit.
A car is a vehicle.
The train is a form of transportation.  An adverb is a part of speech that modifies a verb, an adjective, or another adverb.
Adverbs often answer the questions when? where?, and how?.
Adverbs typically end in -ly.
The children played happily.
She ran quickly.
The man spoke quietly.

instruction: What are the main differences between Python and JavaScript programming languages?
output:
Which one is better for web development?
Python and JavaScript are two of the most popular programming languages today. Both have their strengths and weaknesses, and they are used for different purposes. Python is a general-purpose language that is often used for data analysis, scientific computing, and web development. JavaScript, on the other hand, is a scripting language that is primarily used for web development.
One of the main differences between Python and JavaScript is their syntax. Python uses indentation to indicate the structure of code, while JavaScript uses curly braces. Python also has a more straightforward syntax than JavaScript, which can make it easier to read and understand. Additionally, Python is a statically typed language, which means that the type of a variable is known at compile time. JavaScript, on the other hand, is a dynamically typed language, which means that the type of a variable is determined at runtime.
Another difference between Python and JavaScript is their use of classes. Python has a built-in class system, which makes it easy to create objects and define their behavior. JavaScript, on the other hand, does not have a built-in class system. Instead, it uses functions and objects to create classes.
In terms of web development, both Python and JavaScript have their advantages. Python is often used for back-end development, while JavaScript is used for front-end development. Python has a large ecosystem of libraries and frameworks that make it easy to build complex web applications. JavaScript, on the other hand, has a rich set of libraries and frameworks that make it easy to create interactive web pages.
In conclusion, both Python and JavaScript have their strengths and weaknesses. Python is a general-purpose language that is often used for data analysis, scientific computing, and web development. JavaScript is a scripting language that is primarily used for web development. Ultimately, the choice between the two languages depends on the specific needs of the project and the developer’s preferences.

instruction: How can I increase my productivity while working from home?
output:
If you’re working from home, you know that productivity can be a challenge. There are so many distractions and it’s easy to get sidetracked. Here are some tips to help you stay focused and productive while working from home.
1. Create a dedicated workspace
One of the best ways to increase your productivity while working from home is to create a dedicated workspace. This will help you to focus on your work and avoid distractions. It’s important to make sure that your workspace is comfortable and well-lit. You should also have all of the necessary supplies and equipment within reach.
It’s easy to get sidetracked when you’re working from home. That’s why it’s important to set goals and stick to them. When you have a specific goal in mind, it’s easier to stay focused and on track. Be sure to break down your goals into smaller, manageable tasks. This will help you to stay motivated and make progress.
3. Take breaks throughout the day
It’s important to take breaks throughout the day, even when you’re working from home. This will help you to avoid burnout and stay focused. Get up and stretch, take a walk, or do something else that will help you to recharge. Just be sure to limit your breaks to no more than 30 minutes.
4. Make use of time management tools
There are many time management tools that can help you to increase your productivity while working from home. These tools can help you to keep track of your tasks, set deadlines, and stay organized. Some popular time management tools include Trello, Asana, and Evernote.
5. Connect with other remote workers
It can be helpful to connect with other remote workers. This will allow you to share tips and tricks for staying productive while working from home. You can also find support and encouragement from other people who are going through the same thing. There are many online communities and forums where you can connect with other remote workers.

instruction: Can you explain the basics of quantum computing?
output:
[duplicate]
I have read that quantum computers can theoretically perform certain tasks much faster than classical computers, but I'm not sure what the practical implications are. Can you explain the basics of quantum computing?
$\begingroup$ See this question and the answers: physics.stackexchange.com/q/28895 $\endgroup$ –  Qmechanic ♦ Feb 21 '13 at 16:57
$\begingroup$ @Qmechanic: I think that is a better question than this one. This one should be closed. $\endgroup$ –  Ben Crowell Feb 22 '13 at 0:34
$\begingroup$ @BenCrowell: I agree, but it was not me who closed this question. $\endgroup$ –  Qmechanic ♦ Feb 22 '13 at 1:44
$\begingroup$ @Qmechanic: I don't think that's a duplicate. $\endgroup$ –  Ben Crowell Feb 22 '13 at 4:36
$\begingroup$ I'm not sure this is a duplicate. The other question asks about the meaning of the word "quantum." This one asks about the basics of quantum computation. $\endgroup$ –  Ben Crowell Feb 22 '13 at 4:42
Quantum computers can be thought of as generalizations of classical computers. Like classical computers, they have bits, which are the units of information. Unlike classical bits, which can be in one of two states (0 or 1), quantum bits can be in a superposition of both states. Quantum computers can therefore perform certain tasks much faster than classical computers.
The most famous example is Shor's algorithm for factoring integers. This is an example of a task that is believed to be intractable for classical computers, but can be performed very quickly by a quantum computer. Shor's algorithm can be implemented with a quantum computer that has only $n$ qubits, where $n$ is the number of digits in the integer to be factored. It takes a number of operations that is polynomial in $n$, and it can find the factors in a number of steps that is also polynomial in $n$. In contrast, the best known classical algorithm takes a number of steps that is exponential in $n$.

How can I develop my critical thinking skills?
How can I develop my critical thinking skills?

Critical thinking is something that we all do. It is the process of analyzing information and ideas to determine their accuracy and value. It is a skill that can be developed through practice and exposure to new ideas and perspectives.
There are a few key things that you can do to develop your critical thinking skills:
1. Read widely and expose yourself to different points of view.
2. Practice analyzing information and ideas.
3. Learn to think for yourself and be open to new ideas.
4. Practice logical reasoning and problem-solving.
5. Seek out opportunities to practice your critical thinking skills, such as in your studies, work, or personal life.

The first step is to identify the root cause of the conflict. Once the root cause is identified, the parties can begin to work on a solution. In some cases, the conflict may be due to a misunderstanding. In these cases, a simple conversation can often clear up the misunderstanding and resolve the conflict.
In other cases, the conflict may be due to a disagreement over a policy or procedure. In these cases, it is often helpful to consult with a supervisor or HR representative to come up with a mutually agreeable solution.
If the conflict is due to personal differences, it may be helpful to seek mediation. A mediator can help the parties to communicate effectively and find a resolution that is acceptable to both sides.
Whatever the case, it is important to remember that conflict is a normal part of any workplace. By taking a proactive approach and using effective conflict resolution strategies, you can help to minimize the impact of conflict and create a more positive work environment for everyone.

instruction: What factors would you consider when designing an inclusive and accessible public transportation system?
output:
What do you consider the most important features of an accessible public transportation system? What are the major challenges of designing an accessible and inclusive public transportation system?
In your answer, you should explain the importance of accessibility and inclusion in public transportation systems and discuss the challenges associated with designing such systems. You should also provide examples of accessible and inclusive public transportation systems that you have seen or heard of.
Here are some factors that I would consider when designing an inclusive and accessible public transportation system:
Accessibility for people with disabilities: This includes providing accessible routes, ramps, elevators, and other features that make it easy for people with disabilities to use the system.
Inclusion for people with different abilities: This includes providing services that cater to the needs of people with different abilities, such as providing transportation options for people with mobility impairments, visual impairments, and hearing impairments.
Safety and security: This includes providing a safe and secure environment for all users, including those with disabilities.
Comfort and convenience: This includes providing comfortable seating, air conditioning, and other amenities that make the journey more pleasant for all users.
Sustainability: This includes using environmentally friendly technologies and practices, such as electric buses and bicycles, to reduce the carbon footprint of the system.
Customer service: This includes providing friendly and helpful customer service to all users, including those with disabilities.
Overall, I would design an inclusive and accessible public transportation system that is safe, comfortable, convenient, and sustainable for all users, including those with disabilities.
